verses.kjv: Paul, a servant of God, and an apostle of Jesus Christ, according to the faith of God’s elect, and the acknowledging of the truth which is after godliness;
verses.ct: From Paul, a servant of God and an apostle of Jesus Christ, sent to strengthen the faith of God's chosen people and to help them understand the truth that leads to a godly life —

verses.kjv: In hope of eternal life, which God, that cannot lie, promised before the world began;
verses.ct: all based on the hope of eternal life, which God, who never lies, promised before time itself began.

verses.kjv: But hath in due times manifested his word through preaching, which is committed unto me according to the commandment of God our Saviour;
verses.ct: At just the right time, he revealed his message through the preaching that was entrusted to me by the command of God our Savior.

verses.kjv: To Titus, mine own son after the common faith: Grace, mercy, and peace, from God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ our Saviour.
verses.ct: To Titus, my true son in the faith we share: grace, mercy, and peace from God the Father and Christ Jesus our Savior.

verses.kjv: For this cause left I thee in Crete, that thou shouldest set in order the things that are wanting, and ordain elders in every city, as I had appointed thee:
verses.ct: I left you behind in Crete so that you could finish organizing what still needed attention and appoint elders in every town, just as I instructed you.

verses.kjv: If any be blameless, the husband of one wife, having faithful children not accused of riot or unruly.
verses.ct: An elder must be above reproach, faithful to his wife, with children who are believers and not known for being wild or disobedient.

verses.kjv: For a bishop must be blameless, as the steward of God; not selfwilled, not soon angry, not given to wine, no striker, not given to filthy lucre;
verses.ct: Since an overseer manages God's household, he must be above reproach — not arrogant, not quick-tempered, not a heavy drinker, not violent, and not greedy for money.

verses.kjv: But a lover of hospitality, a lover of good men, sober, just, holy, temperate;
verses.ct: Instead, he should be welcoming to strangers, someone who loves what is good, self-controlled, fair, devoted, and disciplined.

verses.kjv: Holding fast the faithful word as he hath been taught, that he may be able by sound doctrine both to exhort and to convince the gainsayers.
verses.ct: He must hold firmly to the trustworthy message as it was taught to him, so that he can both encourage others with solid teaching and correct those who argue against it.

verses.kjv: For there are many unruly and vain talkers and deceivers, specially they of the circumcision:
verses.ct: There are many rebellious people out there — empty talkers and deceivers — especially among those who insist on circumcision.

verses.kjv: Whose mouths must be stopped, who subvert whole houses, teaching things which they ought not, for filthy lucre’s sake.
verses.ct: They need to be silenced, because they are destroying entire households by teaching things they shouldn't, all for the sake of dishonest profit.

verses.kjv: One of themselves, even a prophet of their own, said, The Cretians are alway liars, evil beasts, slow bellies.
verses.ct: One of their own prophets said it himself: 'Cretans are always liars, vicious animals, and lazy gluttons.'

verses.kjv: This witness is true. Wherefore rebuke them sharply, that they may be sound in the faith;
verses.ct: That statement is accurate. So correct them forcefully, so that they become healthy in their faith,

verses.kjv: Not giving heed to Jewish fables, and commandments of men, that turn from the truth.
verses.ct: and stop paying attention to Jewish myths and rules invented by people who have rejected the truth.

verses.kjv: Unto the pure all things are pure: but unto them that are defiled and unbelieving is nothing pure; but even their mind and conscience is defiled.
verses.ct: To those who are pure, everything is pure. But to those who are corrupt and without faith, nothing is pure — their very minds and consciences are contaminated.

verses.kjv: They profess that they know God; but in works they deny him, being abominable, and disobedient, and unto every good work reprobate.
verses.ct: They claim to know God, but their actions prove otherwise. They are detestable, disobedient, and completely useless for doing anything good.
